TopicTitle: Can't right click docking port- is this a bug?

Articles.Content:
How close are you supposed to be before you can use the 'right click docking port to set as target' function? I'm trying to figure out if this is a bug caused by a plugin going haywire or if I'm just too far away...

Edited August 5, 2013 by Tassyr
You need to be pretty close to the target, like 100m or so.
Nope, this is actually broken, you just get the root part no matter what.

You need to get close enough to sort of visually see it or its general placement, which is usually less than 100m and sometimes closer to 50.

I usually put a a ring of z100 batteries around the docking port, so that the green lights show up from a distance. A low level headlight could also work.

Nope, this is actually broken, you just get the root part no matter what.

What??? I do it all the time.
It's not worked properly for me since 0.17 I think, I can't select an individual port, the selection keeps defaulting to the root part of the target vessel :/

I have always been able to right-click on a docking port from almost too far away to actually see it, though that's only to select one on a ship I've already targeted, because I always target the ship itself from a distance on map view.
Can you select individual ports vanamonde? If you can I'd love to see pics.

I think it works on the navball, but the onscreen target indicator seems to go on the root part.

After a bit of testing I can confirm. a) The distance is approx. >200M before you can select the port.
